thread.title: Sage Northcutt, 19-year-old Texas A&M student, ready for his UFC debut
thread.title_full: Sage Northcutt, 19-year-old Texas A&M student, ready for his UFC debut | Dallas Morning News

author: Joshua Friemel
title: Sage Northcutt, 19-year-old Texas A&M student, ready for his UFC debut
text:
For being just 19 years old and about to be in the first UFC fight of his career, Texas A&M student Sage Northcutt sure did look relaxed at UFC 192's open workouts on Wednesday in Houston.
Northcutt even gave the fans in attendance at the Westin Houston hotel a couple acrobatic leaps and karate-style kicks.
"I'm pumped up for the fight. I'm pumped to see everybody fight," he said. "It's an honor to be out here to do an open workout with everybody. I'm very thankful for this. I've trained my whole life and I've had the UFC as a goal of mine. I've always visualized this. I've always seen myself being able to fight in the UFC. And here it is. I'm excited."
The wide-eyed teenager will fight in his hometown against Francisco Trevino, who has a 12-1 professional record and is 1-1 in the UFC.
Participating in UFC Open Workout
A photo posted by Sage Northcutt (@supersagenorthcutt) on Sep 30, 2015 at 12:43pm PDT
Northcutt acknowledges that his career is moving at an extremely quick pace, but he says he can adjust since he's been fighting since he was six or seven years old in countries like Russia, Croatia and Ireland.
"I've been in front of large crowds when I was little. I guess that's part of it. I guess the bigger the crowd is, the more I feel comfortable."
The Aggie also says he'll be able to balance his excitement about his UFC debut while knowing he has to take care of business.
"I never underestimate anybody," he said. "Everybody who fights in the UFC is in the UFC for a reason. They're all good. I'm looking forward to the fight. I can't wait for the fight. I know that I've trained my hardest. It's going to be an awesome fight."
